newsitem.title: POLAND: TENNIS-PAULUS AND NAGOYOVA MEET AGAIN IN WARSAW FINAL.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-PAULUS AND NAGOYOVA MEET AGAIN IN WARSAW FINAL.

text.p: Top-seeded Austrian Barbara Paulus and defending champion Henrieta Nagoyova of Slovakia set up a rematch of last year's Warsaw Cup final on Sunday.

Paulus, ranked 17th in the world, coasted into the final of the $165,000 tournament by brushing aside Spaniard Virginia Ruano Pascal 6-2 6-1 in the semifinals. Paulus has lost just five games in the tournament so far.
"I am playing well but the clay surface is very slow so it is important to be patient," Paulus said.
Nagoyova fought her way past the number two seed, Ruxandra Dragomir of Romania, in the other semifinal played on Sunday after Saturday's play was rained off.
The hard-hitting Slovak, ranked 39th in the world, held on to win 6-4 7-5 after nearly surrendering early leads in both sets.
The final was being played later on Sunday.
